thread.title: Jobless claims rise for 4th straight week to 277,000
thread.title_full: Jobless claims rise for 4th straight week to 277,000 - MarketWatch

author: Jeffry Bartash
title: Jobless claims rise for 4th straight week to 277,000
text:
WASHINGTON (MarketWatch) â€” The number of people who applied for U.S. unemployment benefits in mid-August rose for the fourth straight week, but initial claims remain at very low levels that suggest the labor market is still on the mend.
Initial jobless claims rose by 4,000 to a seasonally adjusted 277,000 in the seven days stretching from Aug. 9 to Aug. 15, marking the highest level since early July.
Although the upward trend in weekly claims bears watching, the number of jobless workers seeking benefits has held below 300,000 for 24 weeks, the longest stretch in more than 15 years. The economy had added a healthy average of 211,000 jobs a month so far in 2015, and the U.S. is on track to create more than 2 million new jobs for the fifth year in a row.
The average of new claims over the past month, meanwhile, climbed by 5,500 to 271,500, the Labor Department said Thursday. The four-week average smooths out sharp fluctuations in the more volatile weekly report and is seen as a more accurate predictor of labor-market trends.
Also, continuing jobless claims totaled 2.25 million in the week ended Aug. 8, down 20,000 from the start of the month. These claims reflect people already receiving unemployment checks
